content_blocks.title: Advanced Topic Ahead

content.text: You're about to learn Network Traffic Analysis, an advanced technique used by real-world threat actors and security professionals. This knowledge is powerful and must be used ethically.

content_blocks.simplified_explanation: Think of this like learning advanced martial arts - powerful, but requires responsibility.
content_blocks.real_world_connection: This technique is actively used in real-world attacks and defenses.
content_blocks.reflection_prompt: How would you use this knowledge to improve security?

content_blocks.title: Network Traffic Analysis

content.text: This lesson covers: Wireshark, Protocol analysis, C2 detection, Exfiltration patterns. These are advanced techniques requiring solid fundamentals.

content_blocks.simplified_explanation: Core concept: Wireshark enables attackers (or defenders) to detecting threats in packet captures.
content_blocks.real_world_connection: Real threat actors use Network Traffic Analysis daily in active campaigns.
content_blocks.reflection_prompt: What security controls could prevent or detect this technique?

post_assessment.question: What indicates potential C2 traffic?
options: Regular beaconing patterns to external IPs
post_assessment.explanation: C2 traffic often shows regular beaconing patterns (periodic connections) to maintain communication.

post_assessment.question: How can you detect data exfiltration in PCAP?
options: Large outbound transfers to unusual destinations
post_assessment.explanation: Look for large outbound data transfers to unusual external destinations, especially outside business hours.
